alert.note: Alert for Laramie (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued February 06 at 7:36PM MST until February 06 at 7:45PM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM MST FOR SOUTH CENTRAL LARAMIE COUNTY... At 735 PM MST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from near Burns to 10 miles southeast of South Greeley, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow. Gusty winds leading to blowing snow and visibility rapidly falling to less than one-quarter mile. Wind gusts up to 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. Locations impacted include... Carpenter. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions.
